Business Video: Spacey, Moore tackle financial crisis at Berlin film fest Report Abuse Easy solution, change the tax codes on bonuses. Make a sliding scale starting at say 20% on bonuses of$ 2000 or more, up to say 45% for bonuses over 100K and say 75% for bonuses over one million dollars. Actual numbers would need more consideration for an even distribution. Tax all stock options at the highest value of the stock in the past 5 years so that people can't load up on tanking shares that will rebound to maybe 3X their issue value.

Open Forum, where the transnational financial gotham is usually more inclined to consolatory self-indulgence than to serious tackling of controversial international issues. But on this occasion, Afghanistan was debated and harsh questions were asked- namely, Has the West Failed in Afghanistan? This was an implicit riposte, almost ten years later, to Donald Rumsfeld 's optimistic claim of successful American interventionism.
